data.title: Spurs Zone Roundtable: Warriors vs. Spurs Game 4 predictions
data.meta_description: Twitter: @JeffGSpursZoneThe San Antonio Spurs are down 0-3 in their playoff series to the defending NBA champs Golden State Warriors andare facing an elimination game as Game 4 will tip-off tomorrow at the AT&T Center.Will game 4 be the end of the Spurs s
data.text:
Twitter:

The San Antonio Spurs are down 0-3 in their playoff series to the defending NBA champs Golden State Warriors and are facing an elimination game as Game 4 will tip-off tomorrow at the AT&T Center.

Will game 4 be the end of the Spurs season? Can the team rally and extend the series another game?

The Spurs Zone crew discussed Game 4 and gave their predictions in this Spurs Zone Roundtable.

Tyler Clerkin, Spurs Zone:

I think Game 4 is where the Spurs’ season ends. Based on what we’ve seen in the first three games, there is no chance the Spurs pick up the win.

The Spurs should try their best to win, but when it’s all said and done they’re just simply not as skilled as the Warriors.

I think this won’t be a blowout, but the Warriors will win by at least eight to ten points.

Marquez Anderson, Spurs Zone:

The Warriors have just been too much to handle, so I expect the Spurs to come up short again. Golden State has more talent across the board, but I think the Spurs will still try to pick up a win to avoid a sweep.

However, I think it will be unlikely to do so given what we have seen throughout the series.

Derek Machen, Spurs Zone:

This seems like the end of the road for the Spurs’ season.

With Pop out for Game 4, this just seems like a recipe for disaster. It’s tough to combat the likes of Kevin Durant, Klay Thompson and Draymond Green without firepower of their own.

It was a hell of a season considering the circumstances, but San Antonio must focus this offseason on what to do with Kawhi Leonard and ultimately the direction of the franchise.

Jeff Garcia, Spurs Zone Manager:

Mercifully, the Spurs' season will end simply because the Warriors are just a superior team on both ends of the court.

Golden State is averaging more than 100-points per game and defensively, have held the Spurs to under 100-points in two of the three games played.

Toss in the fact Kevin Durant tweaked his ankle in Game 3 as did Shaun Livingston, Golden State will want to end the series to get in rest for the second-round and not run the risk of any other injuries.

The Spurs will put up the good fight but ultimately will be swept.

Agree Spurs fans? Let me know on Twitter at .
